name: A to Z In-Home Tutoring Reviews

review.title: “Good place to work for a part time job.”
review.pros: Pros – The pay was really good. The interview process was really simple, if you met all of the requirements you got the job. My program coordinator was really nice and helpful. You get to chose how many students and how far you are willing to travel to tutor them.
review.cons: Cons – All of the paper work, but that was mandated by the school board and the traveling to each of the kids houses.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great Place for Professional, Personal, and Career Growth”
review.pros: Pros – Support. Resources. Attention. Growth.Support: You have great, friendly, and understanding managerial support.Resources: They provide you with all the resources you will need including assignments.Attention: You get to teach one-on-one. This greatly enhances the child's success rate. Not to mention, this equates to less headaches for you, too.Growth: If you do your job, you'll get recognized for it which leads to eventual promotions!
review.cons: Cons – Hours. Patience.Hours: This is only a Part Time job. It wouldn't hurt to have a few more students, either. Although, their student enrollment is increasing year-by-year!Patience: You have to have patience for some of your students, for their sake. However, if you love teaching, you'll love A to Z.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please don't forget to reward the performing teachers with first picks of students.

review.title: “It's the Little Kids”
review.pros: Pros – Tutoring kids is a fine way to spend your time. The supervisor was very supportive as best she can. You make your own hours and it all about the the parents, the student, and the role as a tutor.
review.cons: Cons – There's no office in state. The office itself is miles away. No contact with any fellow tutors or any face-to-face contact with the company itself.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to connect the tutors together a bit.
